title: Dragon Quest XI
notes: Game runs fine, but at a terrible frame rate.  15-20fps makes it unplayable

title: Dragon Quest XI: Echoes of an Elusive Age
notes: Simply pressed install and ran. No tweaking or editing, just ran perfectly first time.

title: DRAGON QUEST® XI: Echoes of an Elusive Age™ - Digital Edition of Light
notes: Enabling Steam Play for all titles did the trick. Added launch options DXVK_HUD=1 for in-game fps counter and LC_ALL=en_US.utf-8 for english language (UI). No further configuration was necessary to run the game, however, performance is all over the place, sometimes as low as 7 fps and sometimes 55 fps.

title: DUSK
notes: Game itself works and runs great, but has an issue with mouselook where moving the mouse too slow horizontially results in the view drifting to the bottom right. Turning up mouse sensitivity and vsync makes the issue less severe, but still makes aiming ingame janky. Apparently from googling other unity engine games have a similar issue.
specs: Intel Core i5-7400 CPU / GeForce GTX 1060 3GB

title: Glass Masquerade
notes: Crashes at startup

title: Glass Masquerade
notes: Crashes at startup

title: Redout
notes: Launched the game, tested graphics settings, ran a race, exited the game with no crashing. There was some slight stutter at the start of the race, likely shaders caching, after that it ran perfect 60fps with all graphic settings cranked. I had read online that the 32bit version of libmpg123 needed to be installed to fix framerate issues, but apparently either Ubuntu Budgie has it installed already, or Valve is including it with the newer Proton betas as it's known to fix other games as well.

title: DRAGON QUEST® XI: Echoes of an Elusive Age™ - Digital Edition of Light

notes: Game runs perfectly out of the box. Getting 50-60 fps running at max settings at 1440p. I also installed the orchestral music mod. The command line that the mod uses doesn't close automatically, but I have had no issues with it otherwise.

title: DRAGON QUEST® XI: Echoes of an Elusive Age™ - Digital Edition of Light

cpu: AMD Ryzen 5 2400G with Radeon Vega Graphics
notes: Garbled audio no matter what I try. Frame rate is fine and the game is smooth, but the audio basically makes it unfun to play.
title: DRAGON QUEST® XI: Echoes of an Elusive Age™ - Digital Edition of Light

notes: Audio was garbled until I set the launch option "PULSE_LATENCY_MSEC=120 %COMMAND%". Additionally controller support did not work out of box until I installed the steam-devices package and used big picture mode to launch the game. After these two tweaks game runs at a constant 60fps at 1440p max settings.
title: DRAGON QUEST® XI: Echoes of an Elusive Age™ - Digital Edition of Light
